text: if you've ever wondered how on earth
zookeepers tell their animals aparts
take a look at these creatures this is
one of the world's most threatened
amphibians so as well as raising them in
captivity experts here want to study
them in the wild the tags allow the
scientists to color code the frogs which
makes it possible to identify and track
them it's a very delicate process with
each frog given a harmless injection of
fluorescent silicon under its thin skin
the new glowing stripe is carefully
positioned on its underbelly so it can't
be seen by predators having used the
colorful technique to study the frogs
here at the zoo the team is now heading
out to Madagascar where they hope to
find out how golden man tellers move
around their forest habitat so we
expected to know what it will be the
minimum of the maximum distance that
pones can be between how much these
animals can be great between opponent
another if we know these we kind of
start setting up the guidance for the
next steps of active conservation so by
changing their bright color ever so
slightly the researchers hope also to
change the fortunes of these pretty but
very troubled little frogs victoria gill
BBC News
